meanings.sent1: The sun will illumine the room in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She used a flashlight to illumine the dark path.
meanings.sent3: The fireflies illumine the garden like tiny lanterns.
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to illumine the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The candles on the cake illumine the birthday celebration.

meanings.sent1: Reading books can illumine your mind with knowledge.
meanings.sent2: The teacher tried to illumine the confusing concept for the students.
meanings.sent3: His explanation did little to illumine the mystery of the missing keys.
meanings.sent4: Her wise words seemed to illumine the path ahead.
meanings.sent5: The documentary will illumine the history of ancient civilizations.

meanings.sent1: The streetlights illumine the road at night.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse helps to illumine the dangerous rocks for ships.
meanings.sent3: The magician used a trick to illumine the hidden object.
meanings.sent4: The full moon will illumine the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight will illumine the stage during the performance.
